channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: These META trades highlight an underrated trading strategy‚Ä¶
item.description: I tacked on some small wins to my track record yesterday, and it got me thinking: You know what‚Äôs an underrated part of any trading strategy? Momentum. item.title: Mortgage rates fall, but buyer demand drops to 6-month low
item.description: Mortgage applications fell 10.1% in the last week, the Mortgage Bankers Association said.

item.title: Inflation has led to a strong U.S. dollar. But that's not always a good thing.
item.description: A strong dollar may reflect economic strength, but it can have downsides for American consumers.

item.title: Macy‚Äôs cuts sales forecast as department stores struggle to draw shoppers
item.description: Macy's beat quarterly earnings expectations but it cut its sales forecast for the full year.

item.title: Vector Group‚Äôs stock up 6% on deal to be acquired by Japan‚Äôs JT Group in $2.4 billion tobacco deal
item.description: JT, which makes and sells some of the best-known cigarette brands ‚Äî including Winston and Camel outside the U.S. ‚Äî will pay $15 a share in cash, equal to a 29.9% premium over Vector‚Äôs 60-day volume-weighted average share price.

item.title: Health-care system Sesame to offer compounded versions of Wegovy through new $249 weight loss program
item.description: Sesame is offering compounded semaglutide ‚Äî the active ingredient in Wegovy and Ozempic ‚Äî to help users access obesity and diabetes treatments amid shortages.

item.title: 'Pick a number': Strategist says the U.S. dollar will drift much lower against the Japanese yen
item.description: The U.S. dollar is likely to continue to drift lower against the Japanese yen over the coming months, according to one market strategist.

item.title: This S&P 500 hot streak is actually a warning sign for your stocks
item.description: 15 consecutive quarters of revenue growth for S&P 500 companies ‚Äî not enough to support current prices.

item.title: Jennifer Lopez files for divorce from Ben Affleck
item.description: The pair split after more than two decades of playing the on-and-off game.

item.title: China calls EU tariffs on EVs unfair, says it will take necessary measures to defend industry
item.description: Beijing said it continues to believe the EU's probe into China's subsidies for EVs are promoting unfair competition in the name of fair competition.

item.title: U.K. competition watchdog drop probes into Google and Apple app stores
item.description: The Competition and Markets Authority said it plans to use new powers given to it in May to address its concerns about abuses of Google and Apple‚Äôs dominant market positions

item.title: Michelle Obama: Trump used 'misogynistic, racist lies' to 'try to make people fear us'
item.description: Michelle Obama drew explicit contrasts between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

item.title: The world's largest steel industry is going through a 'winter' amid a supply glut and weak demand
item.description: The Chinese steel industry is caught "between a rock and a hard place" as steel makers' margins are getting increasingly squeezed by weak demand, Bank of America executive said.

item.title: It‚Äôs not just stocks ‚Äî there‚Äôs another market reaching into thin air, this banking giant says
item.description: The euro has been on a roll even as European data has been underwhelming.

item.title: Obama says 'America is ready for a new chapter' with Harris, Walz
item.description: Barack Obama, who preceded Donald Trump in the White House, praised President Joe Biden, who served as his vice president.

item.title: Ukraine carries out one of the largest ever drone attacks on Moscow as Kursk incursion continues
item.description: The tides of the Russia-Ukraine war, largely carried out through artillery and drone advances, changed earlier this month.
